description_job: We are looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst / Head of Data with a strong team spirit, to join our dynamic Product Team and help drive our data-centric vision forward. This role reports to the CPO.Position OverviewAs the Senior Data Analyst / Head of Data at United Heroes, you will be the cornerstone of our data initiatives, working with the support of an intern and collaborating closely with our product & tech teams. This pivotal role encompasses four key pillars: managing product performance analytics, driving data innovation, co-creating our data vision, and owning data models management. You will be instrumental in ensuring our product team can track performance, report to executives and investors, co-construct data features, and maintain high data quality across our offerings. This position is both strategic and operational, requiring a strong entrepreneurial mindset and a willingness to be involved from end to end.Key ResponsibilitiesProduct Performance AnalyticsManage and analyze product performance metrics.Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for the product team, executives, and investors.Provide actionable insights to drive product improvements and strategic decisions.Data InnovationCollaborate with the product team to integrate data-driven features into our products.Contribute to the development, delivery, and maintenance of B2B and end-user analytics.Stay updated with the latest data trends and technologies to innovate and improve our data capabilities.Data VisionWork closely with the Chief Product Officer (CPO) to co-build and execute the analytics vision of our offeringInfluence and contribute to the strategic direction of United Heroes through data insights and foresight.Data Models Management OwnershipConstruct, manage, update, and optimize various data models to ensure data quality and integrity.Collaborate with the CTO on data engineering tasks and ensure seamless data flow across systems.Utilize SQL, Python, and other tools to manage data pipelines and databases efficiently.Foster a data-driven culture within Sport HeroesAdvocate for data-driven decision-making across the organization.Align stakeholders on the outcomes they want to achieve and help clarify how to measure successWork closely with other departments (CSMs, tech, marketing, sales) to integrate data practices throughout the organization. --- QualificationsEducation: Masterâ€™s degree in Data Engineering, Statistics, Data Analysis, or a related field.Experience: Minimum of 5 years in a data management role or technical leadership in data analysis or data engineering.Technical Skills:Proficiency in databases and programming languages (SQL, Python).Expertise in data analysis tools (DBT, Mixpanel, Metabase, Looker).Communication Skills: Strong ability to present data insights clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders.Languages: Fluent in English and French.Technical Stack proficiencyData extraction with AWS GlueData transformation and models generation with DBTPipeline and workflow management with AirflowData Warehouse with AWS Redshift databaseBusiness intelligence with MetabaseKey AttributesTeam Spirit: A collaborative attitude with a strong sense of team spirit, eager to work closely with cross-functional teams.Entrepreneurial Mindset: A proactive, self-starter attitude with a passion for taking ownership and driving projects from inception to completion.Strategic and Operational Balance: Ability to balance strategic vision with hands-on operational tasks, ensuring high-level insights translate into practical outcomes.

description_cie: CybelAngel was founded in 2013 in Paris and we count more than 150 employees worldwide (in the US, France, and Europe). We have a culture of team spirit, ambition and a high commitment to ethics.We are constantly looking to add new talents and expertise in order to help us solve the growing security threats over the Web.Our values: Be Curious; Be Bold and Be Stronger Together!CybelAngelâ€™s mission is to create cutting-edge technologies to make the Internet a safer place. We are therefore able to help major companies in securing and protecting their sensitive and confidential information and anticipating high risk security threats.
description_job: This is a new opening within the Engineering department, based in Paris 9 and offering a flexible remote work policy.Your main mission will be to detect and explain potential anomalies in the operation of our advanced cybersecurity threat detection engine. Your results will be communicated toÂ  top management and influence the Product & Engineering roadmap.You will explore gigantic amounts of data, including real-time data from the inner of our engine, historical and statistical data from our data warehouse, as well as detailed technical metrics and timelines of various events. Amongst this data, you will identify the main key metrics that are important to follow and set up adequate dashboarding and monitoring to detect potential anomalies. In the event of an anomaly, you will look for correlations with other events such as code and infrastructure changes, client-specific configuration updates, human interventions, external events, etc. and unravel the chain of causality. Your discoveries will be shared with top management and the Product & Engineering department.To succeed in your mission, you will need to grow an in-depth understanding of our business, how our company operates, what our product does, how our technology works, etc. Your teammates will assist you in this learning process. Additionally, you will have access to senior engineers, product managers and cybersecurity analysts, who will share their expertise with you. This role will position you at a central position in the company.For this position, we seek a senior data analyst, not only with strong analytical skills, but also an endless curiosity for topics ranging from technology to business and everything in between, as well as ability to bridge the gap between these areas and connect seemingly unrelated ideas.Our stackGoogle Looker Studio Pro (dashboard)Google BigQuery (data warehouse)Kibana / ElasticSearch (real-time data)Datadog (technical metrics)Python --- Required skillsAdvanced SQLStrong analytical skillsEndless curiosity for business and technology mattersAutonomy, can-do attitudeFluent in French, proficient in EnglishNo need for prior experience in cyber securityBonus skillsElasticSearchâ€™s query languagePython programming

description_cie: Founded in 2005, Dailymotion is a global video platform built on a clever player and intuitive algorithm connecting over 350 million users to their personal news and entertainment space. It is also the player used by 90% of French media. So, for example, watching videos on Le Monde, Konbini, or Being Sport happens via their player technology. Today, 9 of 10 French internet users watch qualitative content in their ecosystem daily, making them the first French player. Dailymotion is part of the Vivendi media group with headquarters in Paris and offices in New York, Singapore, Montpellier, and Sophia Antipolis.
description_job: Joining the Dailymotion data team means taking part in the creation of our unique algorithms, designed to bring more diversity and nuance to online conversations.Dailymotion is actively looking for a Data Product Manager to join the Data Product Craft, a diverse and dynamic team of more than 20 passionate data analysts, data scientists, machine learning engineers, and data product managers, helping build and grow Dailymotion products.Â As a data product manager for our Analytics platform, youâ€™ll own different data assets & initiatives (user behavior & user acquisition analytics, self-service data platform, â€¦) and pilot their evolution & optimization. Develop & deliver a strategic roadmap, with key metrics to track success and prioritize initiatives. Translate requirements of large data initiatives into smaller actionable items.Be an expert on our data and understand the fundamentals of the data lifecycle: deep knowledge of how, where, and why the data is generated & processed, how it flows between upstream and downstream systems, as well as who produces & who consumes the data.Drive exploratory analysis on user pain points & market trends to identify opportunities to improve our analytics products. Have a clear comprehension of what use cases and insights can or can not be covered by the data today.Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including engineers, developers, data scientists & analysts, product & business, to ensure quality across each step of the delivery & make the final product come to life.Increase the awareness and understanding of our data initiatives & their impacts across all departments through regular presentations & communications.Additional InformationAt Dailymotion, weÂ empowerÂ candidates toÂ takeÂ action.Â If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you!Â If needed, we can accommodateÂ ourÂ recruitmentÂ process forÂ your special abilities.Location:Â Paris (France)Start Date: Upon you availabilitiesÂ Contract Type: Permanent & Full TimeğŸ”Want to learn more about us:Dailymotion.comNew-York office - description_cie: Founded in 2005, Dailymotion is a global video platform built on a clever player and intuitive algorithm connecting over 350 million users to their personal news and entertainment space. It is also the player used by 90% of French media. So, for example, watching videos on Le Monde, Konbini, or Being Sport happens via their player technology. Today, 9 of 10 French internet users watch qualitative content in their ecosystem daily, making them the first French player. Dailymotion is part of the Vivendi media group with headquarters in Paris and offices in New York, Singapore, Montpellier, and Sophia Antipolis.
description_job: Joining the Dailymotion Data Product Craft team means joining a diverse and dynamic team of more than 20 passionate data analysts and data scientists, to help us grow and build the evolution of Dailymotionâ€™s products.Â As a data analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotionâ€™s data-driven strategy. You will be part of a cross-verticals team of other analysts responsible to support the product, business, and engineering teams with insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers, Monetization, Machine Learning, and Engineering teams.Â Your main goal will be to provide insights, based on which product decisions will be made. You will leverage complex and rich datasets to help decision makers better understand users experience on our platforms, player performances, monetization, ...Â Key responsibilitiesÂ Â Explore: Conduct exploratory analyses and leverage data to identify opportunities to improve business and optimize our products. Develop a deep understanding of our product and ecosystem for that purpose.Â Â Experiment: Advise on the experimentation strategy adapted to the need and context. Define, conduct, and analyze AB tests.Â Â Empower: Evangelize on the use of data in the company, train colleagues on analytics tools, build automated dashboards and assets to enable stakeholders to be as autonomous as possible with data.Â Â Â Measure: Analyze the impact of product releases on business metrics, as well as their impacts on products performances.
